intro: Lasiopetalum oppositifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mulla mulla, is a small shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forests and woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
